edu.unika.aifb.foam.main
Class AlignMany

java.lang.Object
  java.lang.Thread
      edu.unika.aifb.foam.main.AlignMany
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
public class AlignMany
extends java.lang.Thread

This class is the main program to align ontologies. For the proper use please refer to the class Main. The algorithms are based on the work of Ehrig et al. as presented at ESWS04, ISWC04, and WWW05. The main alignment method is commented along the source code. The system is currently parameterizable in many ways. For most applications only very simple parameters are actually needed. The package requires KAON2 and for some special parameter cases jwnl.jar, googleapi.jar, and weka.jar. This work is ongoing research and will be constantly enhanced.

Version:
2.0
Author:
Marc Ehrig

public java.util.Vector questions
The user can be given alignments to validate. They are presented through the questions object.

status

public java.lang.String status
Ths status is important when running a thread. It allows to check the current status of the alignment. This makes it possible to retrieve the new results after each iteration.

The name of this thread.
